The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son <FI>is<Fi> the heaviness of his mother.<CM>
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.<RF>the substance…: or, the wicked for their wickedness<Rf><CM>
He becometh poor that dealeth <FI>with<Fi> a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.<CM>
He that gathereth in summer <FI>is<Fi> a wise son: <FI>but<Fi> he that sleepeth in harvest <FI>is<Fi> a son that causeth shame.<CM>
Blessings <FI>are<Fi> upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.<CM>
The memory of the just <FI>is<Fi> blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.<CM>
The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.<RF>a prating…: Heb. a fool of lips<Rf><RF>fall: Heb. be beaten<Rf><CM>
He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.<CM>
He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.<RF>fall: Heb. be beaten<Rf><CM>
The mouth of a righteous <FI>man is<Fi> a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.<CM>
Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.<CM>
In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod <FI>is<Fi> for the back of him that is void of understanding.<RF>of understanding: Heb. of heart<Rf><CM>
Wise <FI>men<Fi> lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish <FI>is<Fi> near destruction.<CM>
The rich man's wealth <FI>is<Fi> his strong city: the destruction of the poor <FI>is<Fi> their poverty.<CM>
The labour of the righteous <FI>tendeth<Fi> to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.<CM>
He <FI>is in<Fi> the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.<RF>erreth: or, causeth to err<Rf><CM>
He that hideth hatred <FI>with<Fi> lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, <FI>is<Fi> a fool.<CM>
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips <FI>is<Fi> wise.<CM>
The tongue of the just <FI>is as<Fi> choice silver: the heart of the wicked <FI>is<Fi> little worth.
The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.<RF>of wisdom: Heb. of heart<Rf><CM>
The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.<CM>
<FI>It is<Fi> as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.<CM>
The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
As the whirlwind passeth, so <FI>is<Fi> the wicked no <FI>more<Fi>: but the righteous <FI>is<Fi> an everlasting foundation.<CM>
As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so <FI>is<Fi> the sluggard to them that send him.<CM>
The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.<RF>prolongeth: Heb. addeth<Rf>
The hope of the righteous <FI>shall be<Fi> gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.<CM>
The way of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> strength to the upright: but destruction <FI>shall be<Fi> to the workers of iniquity.
The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.<CM>
The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked <FI>speaketh<Fi> frowardness.<RF>frowardness: Heb. frowardnesses<Rf><CM>
